fields.description: Instructions on how to change SSL certificates for Walrus and Cloud Controller.  Additionally, instructions on how to back out any changes.
fields.summary: How to change the system SSL keys
fields.environment: HA environment (would be helpful for non-HA environments as well)

comments.body: Linking the two SSL related issues.
Thank you Zach for helping to recover the customer to healthy operation and adding the new certs. The scripts seem to work.  I look forward to reviewing your updates to the wiki.
Aaron to check the Admin guide to make sure this is in there.

*Update* _Adding information that was shared regarding this ticket covering use cases_

The following scenarios are being requested to be covered in our documentation with this ticket:

* SSL Configuration for Console UI => *present* - just need to identify a QA test to confirm it
* SSL Configuration - CLC and Walrus located on the same machine (non-HA) => *present* - just need to identify a QA test to confirm it
( SSL Configuration - CLC and Walrus are on separate machines (non-HA) => *not present* , and need to identify a QA test for it
* SSL Configuration - CLC and Walrus on the same machine (HA - where you have 2 x CLC,Walrus) => *not present*, and need to identify a QA test for it
* SSL Configuration - CLC and Walrus on separate machines (HA - where you have 2 x CLC, 2 x Walrus) => *not present*, and need to identify a QA test for it.

Hope this helps.  Let me know if there are any questions.

Cheers,

Harold Spencer, Jr.
Changed priority from Blocker to critical.  I don't believe this is still a blocker, but we'll look to get this into the docs as soon as we can.

[~hspencer], we have SSL for CLC and Walrus going out in 3.4.2 (individually and on same machine). However, I don't have info for HA configuration. You've asked for CLC/Walrus HA co-location configuration--but this is an unsupported and unrecommended configuration. We earlier recommend that in HA, each Eucalyptus component be on its own machine.

So, for HA separate machines, are the tasks different? Or is it a matter of saying 1. create a keystore, 2. enable CLC (or Walrus) to use the keystore, 3. optionally, redirect requests to different ports--then repeat on the secondary CLC (or Walrus).

Does that make sense?

[~scot.marvin@eucalyptus.com],

Thanks for the heads up regarding the CLC/Walrus HA configuration.  I didn't know that this was an unsupported and unrecommended configuration.  Is this specifically regarding 3.4.2 or was this in reference to previous versions?

For the HA on separate machines, I _think_ its a matter of what steps need to be done on each component.  I am not sure if the [steps that cover setting up SSL in the Eucalyptus Admin Guide is something that needs to be ran on each component|https://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/eucalyptus/3.4/index.html#admin-guide/configuring_ssl.html].   [~zhill]/[~neil], any info here regarding this topic?

[~hspencer], off the top of my head, I think you can just follow the steps on one CLC/Walrus and then copy the euca.p12 to the other CLCs and Walrus hosts once the credentials are in there. The configured property will be enacted on all hosts running eucalyptus-cloud (CLC, Walrus, SC). Obviously, definitely make a backup of the euca.p12 on each host prior to attempting this.

I have not tried this myself, so someone definitely needs to confirm it prior to us publishing anything about it in the docs. [~hspencer] can you give it a try and ensure that things come up correctly? You'll need to restart the eucalyptus-cloud service after copying the key file on each host.

So, [~zhill]/[~hspencer], I think you are you saying that the process is as follows (with help from https://github.com/eucalyptus/Eucalyptus-Scripts/tree/master/general_config_scripts/SSLConfigScript): 

After configuring SSL for the primary CLC/Walrus, do the following:
  # Copy /var/lib/eucalyptus/keys/euca.p12 to the secondary CLC/Walrus, but  use another name for it on secondary CLC/Walrus, for example: "euca.p12.A"
  # Create backup of euca.p12 on the secondary CLC/Walrus. For example, call it "euca.p12.backup.B"
  # On the secondary CLC/Walrus, replace the euca.p12 file with the euca.p12 from the primary CLC/Walrus. For example: cp euca.p12.A euca.p12
  # Restart the secondary CLC/Walrus (services eucalyptus-cloud restart).
  # Ensure that the service starts fully.

Is that it?
[~smarvin], yes, that's the idea. But we definitely need someone to test and verify that procedure.

[~viglesias], do you know if we have tested how to configure SSL for CLC and/or Walrus in an HA environment? If so, can you tell me if what I wrote above (https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/DOC-757?focusedCommentId=62131&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-62131) is correct?

Hey Vic,

Can you answer the question in the last comment in
https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/DOC-757?

Thanks,

-Scot

Hey [~scot.marvin@eucalyptus.com],

We have not tested this against HA. I will add this to the list for 3.4.2 testing.
Sorry for the latency.
Hey [~viglesias], in your copious amount of free time, have you guys tested this yet?

[~tony],

Any luck with your copious amounts of time to try this out :)
[~viglesias], I;ve gotten as far as to have a setup ready for this. Some other items took my time. I will be sure to have it done by COB Monday (Feb 17). I can prioritize sooner if needed.

[~smarvin], I verified the procedure for changing SSL keys in HA and NON HA modes. The information is correct.

Tested version:
Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 3.4.2
Release     : 0.0.548.el6

Topologies Tested
\[CLC\]
\[WS\]
\[CC SC\]
\[NC\]

\[CLC WS CC SC\]
\[CLC WS CC SC\]
\[NC\]

Awesome. Thanks, Tony.
